abstract: The determinants of myocardial oxygen consumption, the consequences of coronary artery atherosclerosis, angina, and myocardial infarction, and their therapy are considered in this article. The mechanism of action of the drugs used in the therapy of myocardial ischemia and the rationale for their use is discussed. A plan of in-hospital rehabilitation for the postoperative myocardial infarction patient is also offered.
